business.headline: Ebix becomes debt-free after acquisition by Eraaya LifeSpacesEbix's successful restructuring and debt-free status mark a new chapter for the company, setting the stage for continued growth and investment in its business operations globally.
ECO Mobility shares list at 17% premium: Should you hold or book profit? ECOS Mobility listing: Shares listed at a premium of 17.15% on the NSE at Rs 391.30, compared to the issue price of Rs 334.

Baazar Style Retail IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusBaazar Style Retail IPO allotment: Investors who applied for Baazar Style Retail Limited IPO can check their allotment status online via the BSE website or through Link Intime India Private Ltd.

Sebi employees accuse top leadership of creating toxic work environment: Report Sebi employees alleged that "shouting, scolding, and public humiliation have become a norm in meetings," creating a hostile atmosphere that has negatively impacted their mental health and work-life balance.

Gold, silver price today, September 4, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today September 4, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Wednesday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

India's services sector growth jumps to 5-month high in August Despite this, companies in the services sector remained optimistic about future demand, although their confidence dipped to its lowest in over a year.
Sensex, Nifty decline as IT shares plunge; Coal India down over 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 404.78 points to 82,150.66 at 10:20 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 136.35 points to trade at 25,143.50.

Risk-takers or safety seekers: Deep dive into Gen Z investment trendsAccording to a report by a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), 55% of cryptocurrency investors are Gen Zs. Additionally, 41% of investments in stocks and 25% of investments in NFTs are made by Gen Zs.
Intel at risk of losing spot in blue-chip Dow Jones index as shares plungeThe Dow Jones index, known for its price-weighted methodology, is heavily influenced by stock prices.
Sensex, Nifty end flat as investors remain cautious; financials gainThe S&P BSE Sensex closed 4.40 points lower to end at 82,555.44, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 1.15 points to close at 25,279.85.

Are IPO investors selling their stakes too soon? Sebi study reveals key insightsThe study also provided insights into the geographical distribution of IPO investors. It found that about 70% of IPO investors were from the top four states: Gujarat, Maharashtra, Rajasthan, and Uttar Pradesh.

Can Reliance shares outperform Nifty with upcoming bonus issue?Despite RIL's 8% underperformance relative to the Nifty so far this quarter, and being underweight among mutual funds compared to its NSE200 weight, there are signs of resilience.
Explained: Why Goldman Sachs sees gold as top investment choiceGoldman Sachs has adjusted its gold price target to $2,700, expecting it to reach this level by early 2025 instead of the end of 2024.
Explained: Why Matrimony.com shares hit 52-week high in early tradeMatrimony.com shares were up 11.26% to Rs 828.95 on the Bombay Stock Exchange at 1:44 pm.
Explained: Why GMR Power shares jumped 5% todayGMP Power share price: Year-to-date, the midcap stock has soared by 140%, and on August 30, it hit a 52-week high of Rs 140 per share.

Aadhaar Housing Finance shares jump over 8%. What should investors do? Aadhaar Housing Finance shares have gained sharply, rising more than 6% in intraday trade. Read on to know the factors driving the surge and what it means for investors.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Check price band, issue size, dates and GMPThe price band for Bajaj Housing Finance IPO is set between Rs 66 and Rs 70 per share. Retail investors must apply for a minimum of 214 shares, requiring a minimum investment of Rs 14,980.
World Bank upgrades India's FY25 GDP forecast to 7%Looking ahead, the World Bank expects India's medium-term outlook to remain positive, with strong growth projected for FY26 and FY27.
Premier Energies shares turn multibagger on debut. What investors need to knowPremier Energies made a blockbuster debut, doubling IPO investors' wealth. Here's what you need to know.

HAL shares soar as Cabinet clears Rs 26,000 crore order. Check target priceThe order is expected to boost HAL's order backlog from Rs 94,000 crore to Rs 1.2 lakh crore, providing strong revenue visibility, according to a report by Antique Stock Broking.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: No hurdles: Sharad Pawar rules out chief ministerial face for Maharashtra pollsThe remarks come at a time when the Shiv Sena (UBT) has been pitching for Uddhav Thackeray as the chief ministerial face of the MVA alliance.

4 Indians, carpooling in Texas, charred to death as truck rams SUV from behindA multi-vehicle collision in Anna, Texas, killed four Indian nationals, including two people from Hyderabad. The four had carpooled and were travelling to Bentonville when a speeding truck rear-ended their SUV, causing it to burst into flames. The impact trapped the four occupants inside the car, and they were charred to death.

IC 814 survivors say Netflix series shows truth but not all of what went down Rakesh and Pooja Kataria, who spoke to India Today TV, were a young couple at the time of the incident. They were returning home from their honeymoon in Nepal. The couple asserted that the codenames used for the hijackers in the Netflix series is true.

Concert by Michael Jackson, lavish weddings: A peek into life of Brunei's SultanThe extravagant and luxurious lifestyle of the Sultan of Brunei, Hassanal Bolkiah, is again in focus as Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited the strategically located nation on the island of Borneo.

The spy on IC 814 who was a ghost passenger in Kandahar hijack Shashi Bhushan Singh Tomar's name wasn't among the names released to the public by the team managing the IC 814 Kandahar hijack. The reason was that he was the RAW station head in Kathmandu. Had the hijackers come to know that Shashi Bhushan was on IC 814, he wouldn't have been let off alive.

Blood stains, 200 pieces of evidence: Chargesheet filed against actor DarshanRenukaswamy Murder: The evidence collected by the police in the murder case against Kannada actor Darshan includes a photograph allegedly retrieved from the phone of an accused, where Renukaswamy can be seen pleading to the accused not to beat him.

Woman hit by SUV in Mumbai, succumbs even as driver rushes her to hospitalA woman was hit by a speeding SUV on Tuesday night in Mumbai's Malad area. After the incident, the car driver himself rushed her to a nearby hospital where she was declared dead by doctors.

Sebi employees accuse top leadership of creating toxic work environment: Report Sebi employees alleged that "shouting, scolding, and public humiliation have become a norm in meetings," creating a hostile atmosphere that has negatively impacted their mental health and work-life balance.
Mobile phones do not lead to brain cancer, mega global study confirmsA new review by the World Health Organisation (WHO) finds no link between mobile phone use and brain cancer.

Sathyabama welcomes the Yorker Champion Jasprit BumrahIn a memorable event, Sathyabama University had the honour of hosting one of India's most celebrated cricket icons, Mr. Jasprit Bumrah. The university's President, Dr. Marie Johnson, and Chancellor, Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, warmly welcomed the champion fast bowler, renowned for his impeccable yorkers, to the campus.

The atmosphere was electric as students gathered in large numbers, eager to catch a glimpse of the cricket sensation. Their excitement and enthusiasm were palpable, reflecting the immense respect and admiration they hold for Bumrah. His visit not only inspired the students but also created an unforgettable experience, further strengthening the bond between sports and academia at Sathyabama University.

One hijacker asked us to convert: IC 814 survivor on what Netflix series missedPooja Kataria, who was on the hijacked IC 814 flight, said that one of the terrorists asked the passengers to convert to Islam.

Man tries to steal artefacts from museum, falls while climbing 25-foot wallA man managed to steal more than 200 coins from the Gupta to Mughal period and other artefacts from Madhya Pradesh's State Museum, but was arrested by the police after he failed to scale the museum's 25-foot wall.

Karnataka family finds 9-foot King Cobra hiding in bedroom. Rescue video A family in Karnataka's Agumbe found a 9-foot-long King Cobra hiding inside a box in their bedroom. The rescue video was posted on Instagram.

Zomato agent brings 2-year-old daughter to work, Starbucks employee shares storyA Starbucks employee posted an appreciation note for a Zomato delivery agent who arrived at their Khan Market outlet with his two-year-old daughter to pick up an order.

PM Modi 'delighted' after meeting Sultan of Brunei: Will further expand tiesPrime Minister Narendra Modi's ongoing visit to Brunei, a key partner in India's 'Act East' Policy and Indo-Pacific Vision, is the first by an Indian head of state. The two nations have had diplomatic ties for 40 years.

Actor Nivin Pauly on sexual assault charges: 'Will prove my innocence'Malayalam actor Nivin Pauly was accused of sexual assault recently. He called for a press conference on September 3 and called the charges a conspiracy to defame him.
Is a food product unsafe to eat beyond its expiry date?A food product nearing its expiry date may make you wary, but experts suggest there are exceptions.

Rahul Gandhi meets Vinesh Phogat, Bajrang Punia amid Haryana poll ticket buzzCongress MP Rahul Gandhi met with wrestlers Vinesh Phogat and Bajrang Punia before heading to Kashmir this morning, fueling speculation about their possible entry into the Congress party.

Company that works with Amazon, Facebook confirms your phone is listening to youThe firm whose clients include Facebook and Amazon has confirmed that there is an Active Listening software that places ads on user's device.

Day 7 Live:  Arshad finishes last, Jyoti Gaderia up nextParalympics 2024, Day 7 Live Updates: Arshad Shaik's run end disappointingly after finishing last in his para-cycling event. Up next is Jyoti Gaderia in the Women's C2 Individual Time Trial. Later in the day, Harvinder Singh and Sachin Khilari will be fighting for medals.
Alia Bhatt's gym session for Alpha: Fans can't stop raving about her back musclesAlia Bhatt is prepping for her next film, 'Alpha'. It is the first female-led film in the YRF Spy Universe.

Bengaluru student assaulted by seniors for refusing to shave beard, case filedA student of Krupanidhi Group of Institutions in Bengaluru was assaulted by his seniors for refusing to shave his beard and moustache. A case has been filed against three accused.

Drinks on me tonight: Sabalenka's hilarious plan for US Open fan support Aryna Sabalenka playfully offered to buy drinks for fans at Arthur Ashe Stadium after her US Open quarterfinal win, securing her fourth consecutive semi-final appearance with a dominant performance against Qinwen Zheng.

Exclusive: IC 814 survivor explains why he avoided watching Netflix seriesRakesh Kataria, one of the passengers on the IC 814 flight when it was hijacked, said that he didn't watch the Netflix series as he didn't want to relive the memories.

Kiran Rao announces Laapataa Ladies release in Japan with Japanese trailerKiran Rao's 'Laapataa Ladies' is the story of two new brides, played by Nitanshi Goel and Pratibha Ranta, who get exchanged on a train. The comedy-drama challenges patriarchy while using the narrative tool of satire.

Alia Bhatt calls mother-in-law Neetu Kapoor her 'beauty inspiration forever'Actor Alia Bhatt called her mother-in-law Neetu Kapoor her 'beauty inspiration' in a new Instagram post. The actor was recently named the global ambassador for a beauty brand.

The Perfect Couple trailer: Nicole Kidman is back with another twisty thrillerHollywood star Nicole Kidman is back with another thriller. This time, she is starring in Netflix's upcoming series, 'The Perfect Couple,' which will also mark the Hollywood debut of actor Ishaan Khatter.

Lollapalooza India returns in March 2025. All you need to knowLollapalooza India will return in March 2025 with a stellar line-up and enhanced concert experience. The early bird ticket bookings will start from September 5.

sports.headline: Pakistan slip to 59-year low after 2-0 series loss to Bangladesh at homeICC Test Rankings: Pakistan slipped two spots to No. 8 in the latest rankings, updated on Wednesday, September 04. The decline came after Pakistan were whitewashed 2-0 at home by Bangladesh on Tuesday.

Paralympics: Indian badminton contingent gets tremendous welcome in DelhiThe Indian badminton contingent arrived the New Delhi after a tremendous run in the Paris Paralympics on Wednesday, September 4. The contingent was greeted at the IGI Airport amidst much fanfare by the fans and family members of the athletes.

Watch: PM Modi speaks to armless archer Sheetal Devi after Paralympics medalParalympics: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to Sheetal Devi via a phone call and congratulated her for her success at the Paralympic Games in Paris. Sheetal won the mixed team compound archery bronze with Rakesh Kumar in Paris. The armless archer said she was happy to have her mother in Paris during her maiden Games appearance.

Yuvraj shared a hilarious training video in which Abhishek keeps ignoring his advice and keeps hitting big sixes.

Injury haunts valiant Dimitrov, Tiafoe vs Fritz in all-American semisUS Open 2024: Frances Tiafoe returned to the semi-final in New York for the first time since 2022 after his opponent, Grigor Dimitrov, retired with an injury in the quarter-final on Tuesday. Tiafoe will face compatriot Taylor Fritz in the first all-American semi-final at a Grand Slam since 2005.

Watch: Roger Federer's roaring return to US Open sends fans into frenzyRoger Federer returned to the US Open, receiving a hero's welcome at Arthur Ashe Stadium as he watched Aryna Sabalenka dominate Qinwen Zheng, securing her record-equalling fourth consecutive semi-final appearance.

'Terrible' Zverev loses to Fritz, semis-bound Sabalenka emulates VenusHome hero Taylor Fritz clinched a brilliant win over fourth-seeded Alexander Zverev on Spetember 4 to secure his spot in what will be his first-ever US Open semi-finals. Sabalenka bested China's  Qinwen Zheng to seal her fourth straight US Open semi-final spot.

Shan Masood not worried about 'job security' after embarrassing loss vs BANPakistan Test captain Shan Masood has said that he is not worried about his job security after 0-2 series loss against Pakistan. The second Test match was Shan Masood's 5th loss as the captain since taking over from the Australia series.

PM Modi congratulates Deepthi Jeevanji for Paralympics bronze winPrime Minister Modi praised Deepthi Jeevanji for her remarkable bronze in the women's 400m T20 final at the Paris Paralympics, marking another milestone in her inspiring journey overcoming challenges on the global stage.

India wins 20 medals, betters Tokyo for best-ever Paralympics tallyIndia added 5 medals to their tally with a late surge on Tuesday, September 2 with Deepthi Jeevanji and Sharad Kumar shinning at the Paris Paralympics 2024. India's total medals in Paris at the end of day 6 was 20.

Sharad Kumar, Mariyappan Thangavelu win silver-bronze in high jumpIndia's Sharad Kumar claimed silver while Mariyappan Thangavelu brought home bronze in the Men's High Jump - T63 Final on September 3, Tuesday. Shailesh Kumar ended up in the 4th spot on the day.

India at Paralympics 2024, Day 7 schedule: Archer Harvinder Singh in focusIndia schedule at Paralympics: The Indian contingent will look to add to its medal tally on Wednesday. Archer Harvinder Singh will be in focus alongside multiple track and field athletes.

Double delight for India as Sundar, Ajeet win silver, bronze in men's javelin F46Paralympics: India ended their Day 6 on a high with two medals in the men's javelin F46 category. Ajeet Singh and Sundar Gurjar were on the podium after a tightly contested final at Stade de France.

India wins 20 medals, betters Tokyo for best-ever Paralympics tallyIndia added 5 medals to their tally with a late surge on Tuesday, September 2 with Deepthi Jeevanji and Sharad Kumar shinning at the Paris Paralympics 2024. India's total medals in Paris at the end of day 6 was 20.

Sharad Kumar, Mariyappan Thangavelu win silver-bronze in high jumpIndia's Sharad Kumar claimed silver while Mariyappan Thangavelu brought home bronze in the Men's High Jump - T63 Final on September 3, Tuesday. Shailesh Kumar ended up in the 4th spot on the day.

Who is Deepthi Jeevanji? Sprinter overcomes challenges to win Paralympics bronzeDeepthi Jeevanji showed her resilience on September 3, Tuesday, to clinch the bronze medal at the Paris Paralympics 2024. Deepthi, a world champion, continued her ascend in the world of athletics with the win.

Navarro reaches first Grand Slam semis with straight sets win over BadosaUSA's Emma Navarro continued her sensational rise in the US Open after knocking out Paula Badosa in straight sets. Navarro, who had knocked out Coco Gauff in the previous round, will take on either Aryana Sabalenka or Qinwen Zheng.

India has trust in PR Sreejesh successors Pathak, Karkera: Sukhjeet SinghIndia's Sukhjeet Singh has claimed that the team has full trust in Krishan Pathak and Suraj Karkera to follow in the footsteps of PR Sreejesh ahead of the Asian Champions Trophy 2024.

World champion Deepthi Jeevanji sprints to bronze in women's 400m T20 in ParisIndia's Deepthi Jeevanji brought home the third track medal in the Paris Paralympics on Tuesday, September 3. Jeevanji sprinted to bronze in the women's 400m T20 final.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
